de.thinktel.utils
Class J3dPolar

java.lang.Object
  de.thinktel.utils.J3dPolar

public class J3dPolar
extends java.lang.Object

This class computes spheric coordinates for the Java3D cartesian coordinate system. Java3Ds cartesian coordinate system differs from the mathematical by rotation of the axes. In Java3D the axis pointing

  • to the right of the screen is the positive x-axis,
  • to to the top of the screen is the positive y-axis and
  • out of the screen towards the viewer is the positive z-axis.
In the mathematical geometric definition the
  • to the right of the screen is the positive y-axis,
  • to to the top of the screen is the positive z-axis and
  • out of the screen towards the viewer is the positive x-axis.

    • Copyright 2009 Joerg Hoehne

    Author:
    hoehne (Jörg Höhne)

    createFrom

    public static J3dPolar createFrom(javax.vecmath.Tuple3d p)
    Create a J3dPolar object defining the same point in spheric coordinates given by the Java3D cartesian coordinate system. This method calls createFrom(double, double, double).

    Parameters:
    p - The point in Java3D cartesian coordinate system.
    Returns:
    The J3dPolar object.

    createFrom

    public static J3dPolar createFrom(javax.vecmath.Tuple3d p1,
                                  javax.vecmath.Tuple3d p2)
    Create a J3dPolar object defining a spheric vector from a source location to a destination location given by the Java3D cartesian coordinate system. This method calls createFrom(double, double, double).

    Parameters:
    p1 - The point of the source in Java3D cartesian coordinate system.
    p2 - The point of the destination in Java3D cartesian coordinate system.
    Returns:
    The J3dPolar object with the spheric vector from source to destination.

    y - The point on the y-axis of the Java3D cartesian coordinate system.
    z - The point on the z-axis of the Java3D cartesian coordinate system.
    Returns:
    The J3dPolar object.
